content.headline: NIO Inc. Reports Record-High Quarterly Deliveries
content.summary: Nio (NIO) has released an update. NIO Inc. has reported a notable increase in vehicle deliveries, with September 2024 seeing a 35.4% year-over-year rise to 21,181 vehicles and the third quarter reaching a record-high of 61,855 vehicles, up 11.6% from the previous year. The company’s cumulative deliveries have hit 598,875, boosted by the new ONVO L60 model, which began shipping in late September. content.headline: Nio Skyrocketed 70%+ in One Month, but Move Might be Overdone
content.summary: It’s been a rough ride for Nio (NIO) shareholders in recent years. While share price volatility has certainly benefited some investors, including myself at points, the NIO stock’s long-term trajectory has been downward. However, over the past month, NIO shares have risen more than 70% from a post-pandemic nadir. Despite some optimism, I’m inherently cautious given potential liquidity challenges and the launch of its lower-margin ONVO brand. I’m currently bearish on NIO. What’s Behind the Rising

content.headline: Stellantis, Nio, Charles Schwab: 3 stocks in focus
content.summary: Morning Brief Hosts Seana Smith and Brad Smith check in on some trending tickers on Yahoo Finance. Stellantis (STLA) shares are under pressure after the carmaker extended the production pause for its electric Fiat until November 1 due to weak demand. The company is also recalling nearly 200,000 hybrid Jeeps over a potential fire risk. Shares of Nio (NIO) are rising after the Chinese electric vehicle maker saw its second-highest number of deliveries ever during September, up more than 35% from a year ago. The company also set a new quarterly record for deliveries in the third quarter. Charles Schwab (SCHW) announced that its CEO Walt Bettinger will retire at the end of 2024 after holding the position for 16 years. He will be replaced by the company's president, Rick Wurster. For more expert insight and the latest market action, click here to watch this full episode of Morning Brief. This post was written by Melanie Riehl

content.headline: NIO Secures Multi-Billion Investment for Subsidiary
content.summary: Nio (NIO) has released an update. Chinese electric vehicle pioneer NIO Inc. has announced a significant RMB3.3 billion cash investment from strategic investors into its subsidiary, NIO China, while also committing an additional RMB10 billion itself. This move will slightly dilute NIO’s controlling interest in NIO China to 88.3%, but it underscores investor confidence in NIO’s market leadership and paves the way for future growth.
